TopicTitle: B9 engine modification: need you guys!

Articles.Content:
Hey,

I'm working on adjusting thrust and fuel consumption of B9 engines, but I'm terrible at balancing, so I need you guys to help me and to propose me fuel consumption in function of thrust rates below, or thrust rates and fuel consumption if my thrust rates are bad.

Thrust rates: 

closedcycle:

space: 104500

atmosphere (water level): 114300

 

Hybridplasma:

space: 62340

atmosphere: 11720

 

you guys are good at balancing thrust/isp/fuel c. rates? tell me what Isp or fuel consumtion shall I put in those cfg files. thanks

 

(for those who are interested, ask and I'll give you the cfg after having balanced values.)

Edited July 9, 2016 by Tomato29

B9 engines are nicely balanced as it is, what exactly are you trying to do?

Well I say that but I only use the jets & bi-modes. Those seem nicely balanced though.

Edited July 9, 2016 by Van Disaster

13 hours ago, Van Disaster said:

B9 engines are nicely balanced as it is, what exactly are you trying to do?

Well I say that but I only use the jets & bi-modes. Those seem nicely balanced though.

yep jets are okay but the heavy-weight one is awful, you have to attach a lot of those to feel like your ship is doing something.
